etymology.description: semantic: 鳥 ‘bird’ + phonetic: 凡; simplified from 鳳 (𩾏 → 又).
etymology.interpretation: Combines the bird component 鳥 with the phonetic 凡 to name a mythic bird, with 凡 contributing the sound. In simplification, the semantic bird part was dropped and the form was streamlined around the phonetic, following the 𩾏 → 又 reduction pattern seen in bird-related characters.
etymology.simplification: The semantic 鳥 component was removed and the graph reduced to a form based on the phonetic 凡, reflecting a general policy of simplifying complex semantic components (notably the bird series) to simpler shapes.

examples.chinese: 古人把凤视为祥瑞之鸟(古人把鳳視為祥瑞之鳥)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔrén bǎ fèng shìwéi xiángruì zhī niǎo.
examples.english: Ancient people regarded the phoenix as an auspicious bird.

examples.chinese: 她姓凤，家族来自山西(她姓鳳，家族來自山西)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xìng fèng, jiāzú láizì Shānxī.
examples.english: Her surname is Feng, and her family comes from Shanxi.

examples.chinese: 雕刻师刻出一只优雅的凤(雕刻師刻出一隻優雅的鳳)。
examples.pinyin: Diāokèshī kè chū yī zhī yōuyǎ de fèng.
examples.english: The carver produced an elegant phoenix.
